Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Komast pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; exterior: part of incised blob rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1306) (phase 2)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 329, no. 1557, pl. 199, no. 1557)
